column5: With this very very slow to hard water season, I have not even got my butt in gear to head out. I bought the clam adaptor just over a month ago and was still in the box an hour ago. My finder was still in soft water mode for the toon.  After reading some, some what positive reports, I got that tingly feeling and got my butt busy this evening.  Clam out of the box,together,( with ease I must say) , finder back in the soft bag, rods,well need some attention, but Im ready to go,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,   Dang, I need a smitty to carry all this stuff. No problem, almost ready for maiden run. Just got to get the skies attached.  The weekend looks scetchy, but after that, Im sure there will safe ice out there.  Be safe,carry a spud, and let your bud walk ahead of you. Age before beauty.

I'll let you know how your previous smitty does come Sunday. Looks like I will be able to hit Cooch for some Jumbos.  Her real test will be in about a month or so when I decide to make the trek back out to long shoal.  See ya on the hard water.
Your wife is gonna stick that auger up your arse for cluttering up the kitchen.  Looks good to me though Bri.

I'll let you know how your previous smitty does come Sunday. Looks like I will be able to hit Cooch for some Jumbos.  Her real test will be in about a month or so when I decide to make the trek back out to long shoal.  See ya on the hard water.  Sunday I could do if the ice is good.  Long shoal trek days by foot, are way long gone for me.LOL

Your wife is gonna stick that auger up your arse for cluttering up the kitchen.  Looks good to me though Bri.   All put away before she gets home from work. I know better.  You see her weapons attached to the wall? LOL
I guess you didnt notice the heaps of rain and above zero weather forecasted down there this weekend  Good luck if you find somewhere safe
I guess I should start looking for my stuff too
You need to give me a couple of those rods Brian, you have too many! Rob
Gunna be warm this weekend.  No need for a hut!!  Hopefully tomorrow doesn't get warmer then what they're calling for.  Which hut is that in the pic?
My snowblower is still in the shed.   Can't work up the energy to haul it down with what little winter we've had. Ice gear still buried under a mountain of crap.
Well the weather and temps, seem to have changed a bit. Calling for snow instead of rain.  That's the two man Nick. Im heading up after work, to pick up the new one.  Cant wait til Saturday for it.

can i ask where you picked up the clam adapter? ive been trying to find one from a canadian online retailer but no dice. Im highly interested in one of these things, after last year the swede with the swede bore my arms fell off after two holes lol
I need to get my butt in gear.
